p: Although guidelines exist for intubation and bag-mask ventilation, less has been written about head and neck surgical procedures, many of which can generate aerosolized virus 13. Reports indicate that health care teams participating in these procedures are at increased risk of infection 14. This article describes the anesthetic and surgical care of patients undergoing head and neck procedures during the COVID-19 pandemic. We present recommendations for scheduling, procedure selection, airway management, PPE, and preprocedural testing.
